q: When viewing a nearby image, the two eyes  _____, and the _____ becomes _____, in order to focus the image on the retina of both eyes.

a.a: Diverge, cornea, thinner
a.b: Converge, lens, thicker?
a.c: Converge, lens, thicker
a.d: Diverge, iris, thinner
a.e: Converge, lens, thinner

q: Upon entering your eye, a photon of light passes through things in which order before reaching the retina:

a.a: Cornea, aqueous humour, pupil, lens, vitreous humour
a.b: Pupil, cornea, aqueous humour, lens, vitreous humour
a.c: Cornea, vitreous humour, pupil, lens, aqueous humour
a.d: Lens, pupil, vitreous humour, cornea, aqueous humour
a.e: Cornea, lens, aqueous humour, pupil, vitreous humour

q: The PLR will constrict both pupils if bright light is shone into a single eye.

a.a: true
a.b: false

q: In myopia, far-away things appear blurry because they are focused behind the retina. (F – in myopia, far-away images are focused in front of the retina).

a.a: true
a.b: false

q: The retina’s blind spot results from

a.a: Damage to the retina during development
a.b: A patch of ganglion cells that do not receive photoreceptor input
a.c: The optic nerve, which leads to a patch of retina without photoreceptors
a.d: The fact that the fovea contains exclusively cones
a.e: An unknown cause

q: Which of these best describes the concept of a retinal mosaic

a.a: The finding that a single cell type tiles the retina such that the visual scene is sampled at all points by a given cell type
a.b: The connectivity pattern of photoreceptors making synapses with bipolar cells and ganglion cells making synapses with ganglion cells
a.c: The fact that retinal neurons are connected with both electrical and chemical synapses
a.d: The computation of center-surround receptive fields
a.e: The finding that the retina becomes thinner in the foveal region

q: Which of these statements is false

a.a: Photoreceptor provide input to horizontal cells and bipolar cells
a.b: Horizontal cells directly modulate responses in photoreceptors and bipolar cells
a.c: Bipolar cells provide input to amacrine and ganglion cells
a.d: Amacrine cells only provide input to other amacrine cells
a.e: Ganglion cells are the only retinal neurons to send axons out of the eye to the brain

q: Which of the following statements is false

a.a: Photoreceptors are neurons specialized for detecting photons due to their opsin-rich outer segments
a.b: Rods are adapted for detecting light in dim environments whereas cones are important for detecting light in brighter environments
a.c: Photoreceptors have a hyperpolarized membrane potential in the dark
a.d: Photoreceptors have very high energy requirements and have a mitochondria-rich inner segment
a.e: Photoreceptors release glutamate from the axon terminal at ribbon synapses

q: During the phototransduction cascade, a photon of light activates _______, which in turn activates ________, which leads to activation of _______, which ______ into ______, and leads to the closure of _______.

a.a: Rhodopsin, transducin, phosphodiesterase, cGMP, GMP, cGMP-gated channels
a.b: Rhodopsin, phosphodiesterase, transducin, GMP, cGMP, GMP-gated channels
a.c: Transducin, phosphodiesterase, rhodopsin, cGMP, GMP, cGMP-gated channels
a.d: Phosphodiesterase, rhodopsin, transducin, GMP, cGMP, GTP-gated channels
a.e: Phosphodiesterase, transducin, rhodopsin, cGMP, GMP, GMP-gated channels

q: Which statement properly describes the visual cycle – the changes that retinal goes through from the time it absorbs a photon until it is ready to absorb another photon of light?

a.a: 11-cis retinal 11-cis retinol  all-trans retinol  all-trans retinal  11-cis retinal
a.b: 11-cis retinal all-trans retinal  all-trans retinol  11-cis retinol  11-cis retinal
a.c: all-trans retinal  all-trans retinol  11-cis retinol  11-cis retinal  all-trans retinal
a.d: all-trans retinal  11-cis retinal  11-cis retinol  all-trans retinol  all-trans retinal
a.e: 11-cis retinol all-trans retinol  all-trans retinal  11-cis retinal  11-cis retinol

q: What is a key role of horizontal cells?

a.a: They directly convert photons of light into electrical signals
a.b: They serve the basis of color vision
a.c: They provide surround inhibition to photoreceptors
a.d: They are critical for the computation of direction selectivity
a.e: They have no known roles in retinal computations

q: Bipolar cells come in both ON and OFF types. Which of the following is true?

a.a: ON bipolar cells express mGluR6 receptors and depolarize when photoreceptors increase release of glutamate
a.b: OFF bipolar cells express ionotropic glutamate receptors and hyperpolarize when photoreceptors increase release of glutamate
a.c: ON bipolar cells express ionotropic glutamate receptors and hyperpolarize when photoreceptors increase release of glutamate
a.d: ON bipolar cells express mGluR6 receptors and hyperpolarize when photoreceptors increase glutamate release
a.e: OFF bipolar cells express mGluR6 receptors and depolarize when photoreceptors increase glutamate release

q: Bipolar cells come in both ON and OFF types. Which of the following is true?

a.a: ON bipolar cells have longer axons that terminate closer to the ganglion cell layer
a.b: OFF bipolar cells have longer axons that terminate closer to the ganglion cell layer
a.c: OFF bipolar cells have shorted axons that terminate close to the inner nuclear layer
a.d: a and b are both correct
a.e: a and c are both correct

a.a: ON bipolar cell
a.b: OFF bipolar cell

q: Which of the following statements about center-surround receptive field organization is incorrect?

a.a: Center-surround receptive fields were first described in retinal ganglion cells by Steven Kuffler and Horace Barlow.
a.b: Center-surround receptive fields arise from lateral inhibition, from horizontal cells and amacrine cells.
a.c: Center-surround receptive fields are the basis of direction selectivity.
a.d: Center-surround receptive fields are present only in photoreceptors.
a.e: Center-surround receptive fields help retinal ganglion cells encode local changes in luminance contrast.

q: A critical part of the direction selective retinal circuit is:

a.a: Asymmetric connectivity between horizontal cells and bipolar cells
a.b: Inhibition from starburst amacrine cells on bipolar cells
a.c: Null direction inhibition from starburst amacrine cells to ganglion cells
a.d: Null direction excitation from starburst amacrine cells to ganglion cells
a.e: Electrical coupling between directionally selective ganglion cells

q: Which of the following statements regarding rod and cones pathways is true?

a.a: Rod and cone signals take the same pathway through the retina in order to leave the eye
a.b: Rods synapse with a specialized ON bipolar cells that allows rod signals to pass into the cone signalling pathway
a.c: Cones synapse with a specialized OFF bipolar cell that allows cone signals to pass into the rod signalling pathway
a.d: Cones signals pass from bipolar cells to ganglion cells, whereas rods directly synapse with ganglion cells
a.e: In many people, rod photoreceptors are non-functional

a.b: Saccades ensure that the image projected onto our retina is constantly updated
